result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather M Anderson-Robles

Letter from defendant requesting Attorney Forseth withdraw from the case and requesting the court to appoint an attorney

10:26 AM Defendant Heather M Anderson-Robles in court.  Attorney Robert N Forseth in court for Heather M Anderson-Robles.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Forseth wants this to track with the new case the defendant has. Bond is continued.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:07 PM Attorney Amanda Forseth in court for Heather M Anderson-Robles.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Heather M Anderson-Robles appeared by phone. Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued

1:07 PM Attorney Amanda Forseth in court for Heather M Anderson-Robles.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Heather M Anderson-Robles appeared by phone. Atty forseth waives the preliminary hearing.  Court questions Anderson Robles regarding the waiver and accepts.  Court binds over for Arraignment.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
